title: EXCLUSIVE: Current UNLV assistant coach, NBA vet and friend of Lamar Odom: “My first reaction is my heart got heavy”
text: Share Updated: 10/14 2:21 pm LAS VEGAS (KSNV News3LV) -- With a career that marks cheers from thousands of fans, two NBA championship rings and a Sixth Man of the Year award, the recent buzz about Lamar Odom has been anything but a celebration.The 6’10” former Los Angeles Lakers star was found unconscious at the Love Ranch brothel in Crystal, NV Tuesday afternoon. Odom was driven to Sunrise Hospital by ambulance, where reports of his ailing health flooded media outlets across the country. Sunrise Hospital has not released any official statements about his condition, news which has concerned his fans, his former teammates and friends.“My first reaction is my heart got heavy,” said UNLV basketball legend and current assistant coach, Stacey Augmon.Augmon played in the NBA for 15 years, where he matched-up against and met Odom. The two have been friends for years, and now that they're back in the same city, Augmon says he plans to go see his friend."I'm gonna try to go down to the hospital and just try to be by his side... But I'm gonna make an effort to be there,” said Augmon. “There's so many things that you're hearing about right now, I really don't know the details.”Many of Odom's friends and former teammates have taken to social media asking for prayers for their former teammate. Odom’s name was also trending on Twitter, as concerned fans expressed similar sentiments of concern, fear and prayer. “At the end of the day I just want him to wake up, and be in good health,” said Augmon.
